/**
 * \mainpage
 * 
 * \htmlonly
 * Acronyms
 * <table border="1">
 * <tr><td width="50px">AL</td><td>Abstraction Layer. Static callback functions that are called by SAGPS to store and retrieve data from a target's local data store.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">AGPS</td><td>Assisted GPS</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">API</td><td>Application Programmers Interface</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">BCE</td><td>BroadCast Ephemeris.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">CL</td><td>Chipset Library. The Rx Networks chipset library provides a common interface to support a variety of standard chipsets operations. This library shields the user from all chipset specific messaging and/or API calls as required by GPStream products.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">CIL</td><td>Chipset Interface Layer. Code which contains logic to drive the CL. It includes all chipset-specific logic elements that collect BCE data and inject EE data through the CL.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">EE</td><td>Extended Ephemeris.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">EVK</td><td>Evaluation Kit consisting of Evaluation System executable software, and supporting documentation. Customers can use the EVK to evaluate GPStream&trade; products, perform prototype integrations, and demonstrate prototype systems to their end customers.   </td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">GEEL</td><td>Generate Extended Ephemeris Layer. Code that handles EE generation.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">GPS</td><td>Global Positioning System </td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">GNSS</td><td>Global Navigation Satellite System</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">IODE</td><td>Issue of Data Ephemeris</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">IP</td><td>Internet Protocol</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">LCS</td><td>Location Services</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">NV</td><td>Non-Volatile</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">PRN</td><td>Pseudo Random Number. Synonymous with SV within this document.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">RIL</td><td>Radio Interface Layer, a Microsoft term describing the driver code that abstracts radio chipsets and supports a standardized interface that is utilized within Windows Mobile.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">SAGPS&trade;</td><td>Self-Assisted GPS</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">SDK</td><td>Software Development Kit. Consists of a GPStream&trade; library; abstraction layer; integration example; and a complete documentation set.  </td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">SV</td><td>Satellite Vehicle. Synonymous with PRN within this document.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">TCP</td><td>Transmission Control Protocol</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">TTFF</td><td>Time To First Fix</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">URA</td><td>User Range Accuracy. Satellite position accuracy is commonly described by a URA index (see IS-GPS-200D). <br/>Note that in the current SAGPS release, URA index values do not match URE values as stipulated within IS-GPS-200 Rev D. For the best indication of EE accuracy, integrators should directly reference URE (see below).</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">URE</td><td>User Range Error. Describes the error associated with satellite position predictions (typically in Meters). See reference IS-GPS-200D for a detailed description of URE.</td></tr>
 * <tr><td width="50px">UTC</td><td>Coordinated Universal Time.</td></tr>
 * </table>
 * \endhtmlonly
 */
